scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-350 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-350 is a star with 1.19 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.53 times its radius. It is located 3120.85 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-350 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-350 system


Kepler-350 b

Kepler-350 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-350 b is 4.070 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-350 b is 1.850 that of Earth. At 4.070 Earth masses, Kepler-350 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


Kepler-350 c

Kepler-350 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-02, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-350 c is 6.042 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-350 c is 3.100 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-350 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


Kepler-350 d

Kepler-350 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2014-02, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.18 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-350 d is 14.946 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-350 d is 2.800 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-350 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-350, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-350 - System With 3 Exolanets
